titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Tim Stevens Papers, 1945-2006 AIS.2006.11
titlestmt.author: Ashley L. Taylor.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-06-11 09:35:43 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.abstract: The collection documents the life and career of Tim Stevens, a prominent African American figure in the Pittsburgh community. Stevens served as president of the Pittsburgh branch of the NAACP (1994-2004) and was responsible for advocating for the rights of the African American community. This collection contains correspondence, meetings minutes, brochures, flyers, personal notes, news articles, memos, cassette tapes, VHS tapes and photographs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: The Tim Stevens Papers focus mainly on the period between 1994 and 2004 when Stevens served as President of the NAACP Pittsburgh branch. There is also material included on projects he initiated, particularly B-PEP and the Black and White Reunion. There are also personal materials, mainly concerning his career as a jazz vocalist and songwriter. The collection contains correspondence, news articles, memos, personal notes, meetings minutes, flyers, brochures, photographs, cassette tapes, compact discs, LPs and VHS tapes.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed by Ashley L. Taylor in early 2010. Some material was weeded from the collection, mainly issues of newspapers and magazines, unsolicited mail, personal financial and medical information, and duplicate materials.

odd.head: Previous Citation
odd.p: Tim Stevens Papers, 1945-2006, AIS.2006.11, Archives Service Center, University of Pittsburgh

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Tim Stevens Papers, 1945-2006, AIS.2006.11, Archives & Special Collections, University of Pittsburgh Library System

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The University of Pittsburgh holds the property rights to the material in this collection, but the copyright may still be held by the original creator/author. Researchers are therefore advised to follow the regulations set forth in the U.S. Copyright Code when publishing, quoting, or reproducing material from this collection without the consent of the creator/author or that go beyond what is allowed by fair use.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Timothy (Tim) Stevens was born in Pittsburgh, Pa., on May 4, 1945 to Georgetta and Jaspar Stevens. He was raised in the Hill District and attended the University of Pittsburgh, earning his Bachelor's Degree in Political Science in 1967 and his Master's Degree in Urban and Regional Planning in 1974.

In the wake of the 1968 assassination of Martin Luther King, Jr., Stevens decided to take a larger role in his community. In 1970, he became Executive Director of the Pittsburgh branch of the NAACP, holding this position for four years. In 1977, he began working as a volunteer coordinator at Mayview State Hospital. By 1990, he was made Director of Volunteer Resource Services, a position he currently holds. In 1986, Stevens founded the Black Political Empowerment Project (B-PEP), an organization aimed at promoting African American involvement in local, state, and national elections.

In November 1994, Stevens was elected President of the Pittsburgh branch of the NAACP. Over the next decade, Stevens would be continually re-elected to this position, being both praised and criticized for his very vocal presence in the media and his advocacy for African American rights and interests. Stevens took great interest in the tension between the African American community and the Pittsburgh Police Department. One of his projects, the Black and White Reunion, arose out of the controversial death of Jonny Gammage at the hands of the police. This project aimed to bridge tensions between the African American and Caucasian communities in Pittsburgh. Stevens lost the NAACP presidential election in late 2004, but left his mark on both the NAACP and the Pittsburgh community, where he still continues to be an active advocate for African Americans.

Stevens is also a well-known jazz performer and vocalist. He has written a variety of songs, including one recorded by Nancy Wilson. He has produced and released several albums, both solo and with his ensemble, the Tim Stevens Project. He also serves as a contributing editor for Pittsburgh Magazine's jazz section.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection in arranged into five series:
Series I. Black Political Empowerment Project (B-PEP), 1986-2004
Series II. Black and White Reunion, 1997-2005

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Tim Stevens on June 6, 2006.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials related to the Black Political Empowerment Project, known as B-PEP. This organization was founded by Stevens in the 1980s, and aimed to increase African American voting participation in the Pittsburgh community. This series contains correspondence, mailing lists, brochures, event information, and other documentation detailing B-PEP's activities throughout the 1980s, 1990s, and up to 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials relating to the Black and White Reunion, another organization initiated by Stevens. Stevens founded the project in 1997 in the wake of the controversial death of Jonny Gammage at the hands of Pittsburgh police. The organization aimed to build bridges between the African American and Caucasian communities in Pittsburgh. The material in this collection includes brochures, correspondence, flyers, meeting minutes, Stevens' personal notes, news clippings, and other documentation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials related to Stevens' leadership in the NAACP. He served as President of the organization from 1994 to 2004, and his decade-long leadership was a very prominent part of Pittsburgh's political and cultural scene. This series is divided into 21 subseries, each reflecting a main focus of the NAACP's efforts. The majority of the files were arranged by subject by Stevens, and the remaining files were arranged in the same manner. This series contains correspondence, brochures, meeting minutes, flyers, memos, notes, agendas, news clippings, and publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains material relating to the administrative functions of the NAACP from 1974 to 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains material related to the NAACP's efforts to stop violence in the community, from 1994 to 2005.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains material relating to the NAACP's involvement in the community, from 1990 to 2004.

did.unittitle: National Conference for Community and Justice

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains material relating to the NAACP's interest in issues of economic development from 1994 to 2004. Included in this are partial records of the Economic Development Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains material relating to the NAACP's interest in educational issues, from 1995 to 2004. Included in this are partial records of the Education Committee.

did.unittitle: Institute for Community Leadership in Education

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains material concerning the NAACP Executive Committee from 1971 to 2005, with the great bulk of the material focusing on Stevens' presidential tenure from 1994 to 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains material relating to the NAACP's finances from 1993 to 2005. Included in this are partial records of the Finance Committee.

did.unittitle: African American Chamber of Commerce Grant

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains material relating to the NAACP's concern with health issues, from 1999 to 2004. Included in this are partial records of the Health Committee.

did.unittitle: Black Papers on African-American Health in Allegheny County

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials relating to the NAACP's interest in housing issues, from 1995 to 2003. Included in this are partial records of the Housing Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries includes material relating to the NAACP's interest in labor disputes and industrial development, from 1994 to 2004. Included in this are partial records of the Labor and Industry Committee.

did.unittitle: Executive Action Plea for Fairness and Equity
Minority Employment in the Construction Industry

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials relating to issues that the NAACP pursued through litigation or legal attention, from 1994 to 2004. Included in this are partial records of the Legal Redress Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains material relating to NAACP membership, from 1994 to 2004. Included in this are partial records of the Membership Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains material relating to Stevens' individual involvement with the NAACP, mainly campaign material and personal notes, from 1992 to 2004.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials relating to the NAACP's concern with police affairs in Pittsburgh, from 1990 to 2004. Included in this are partial records of the Police Affairs Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials relating to political affairs concerning the NAACP, with a main emphasis on voter registration drives, from 1992 to 2005. Included in this are partial records of the Political Action Committee.

did.unittitle: City County Conference on Affirmative Action

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains material relating to the press and publicity the NAACP received, mainly in the form of news clippings, articles, and press releases, from 1974 to 2006. Included in this are the partial records of the Press and Publicity Committee.

did.unittitle: M. Gayle Moss in the News

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials relating to the NAACP's concerns regarding prisons and prisoners' rights in the region, from 1995 to 2004. Included in this are the partial records of the Prison Affairs Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials relating to special events and projects the NAACP sponsored or spearheaded, from 1995 to 2006.

did.unittitle: Martin Luther King, Jr. Forum Series
Mon Valley Branch Human Rights Dinner
Summit of Black Imaging in the Media

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials relating to tensions in race relations and the NAACP's attempts to mediate these disputes, from 1995 to 2004.

did.unittitle: Brown v. The Board of Education

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains materials related to the NAACP's involvement in religious organizations in Pittsburgh, from 1993 to 2005. Included in this are the partial records of the Religious Affairs Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This subseries contains information related to the NAACP's involvement with youth in the community, from 1995 to 2004. Included in this are the partial records of the Youth Committee.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains materials related to Stevens' personal pursuits outside of the NAACP. The main bulk of this series contains information on his musical career, but there is also material concerning his education and family. This series contains news articles, flyers, playbills, correspondence, sheet music, awards, commencement brochures, and a school yearbook.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Notes
scopecontent.p: This series contains audio-visual materials and memorabilia reflecting Stevens' involvement in events spanning his career and interests. There are six subseries, arranged by media format. This series includes photographs, compact discs, LPs, memorabilia, VHS tapes and cassette tapes.
